verses.text: 耶利米質疑惡人為何亨通耶和華啊！我跟你爭辯的時候，總是你有理；然而我還要跟你討論有關公正的問題。惡人的道路為甚麼亨通？所有行詭詐的為甚麼都得享安逸？
你栽種了他們，他們也扎了根，並且長大，結出果實；他們的口中有你，心裡卻沒有你（「他們的口中有你，心裡卻沒有你」原文作「你與他們的口很接近，卻離他們的心很遠」）。
但耶和華啊！你認識我，了解我，你察驗了我對你的心意。求你把他們拉出來，好像將宰的羊一般；求你把他們分別出來，留待宰殺的日子。

words.note: Often implies divine scrutiny.
Can refer to God's will or human intent.
Often implies consecration in biblical context.

verses.text: 這地悲哀，田野的青草都枯乾，要等到幾時呢？由於這地居民的惡行，走獸和飛鳥都滅絕了；因為他們說：「 神看不見我們的結局。」

words.note: Often used in biblical contexts for land animals.
Often preceded by a space for reverence in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 耶和華說：「如果你與徒步的人同跑，尚且覺得疲倦，怎能跟馬賽跑呢？你在平安穩妥之地，尚且跌倒，在約旦河邊的叢林怎麼辦呢？

words.note: A key theological concept in the Bible.
Classical Chinese particle, often in formal or biblical texts.
Specific biblical reference to 'thickets of the Jordan'.

verses.text: 因為連你的兄弟、你的父家，都以詭詐待你，連他們也在你後面高聲喊叫。雖然他們對你說好話，你也不可信他們。」

words.note: Refers to the extended family or clan of one's father.
More formal/literary than '用'.
Often found in biblical contexts describing sin.
Often used in biblical contexts for crying out to God or in protest.
A common prohibition in classical Chinese and biblical texts.

verses.text: 遍地荒涼「我撇下了我的家，丟棄了我的產業；我把我心愛的交在她仇敵的手中。

words.note: Often found in biblical descriptions of widespread conditions.
In biblical context, often refers to inherited land or people of God.
A common term in the Bible for adversaries of God's people.
Figurative usage implying control or power.

verses.text: 我的產業對我，就像樹林中的獅子向我咆哮，因此我恨惡她。

words.note: Refers to God's chosen people or his acquired possession.

verses.text: 我的產業對我，不就像一隻帶斑點的鷙鳥，其他的鷙鳥都四圍攻擊她？你們去聚集田野各樣的走獸，帶牠們來吃吧！

words.note: Refers to God's chosen people or his acquired possession.
Used to pose a rhetorical question, expecting agreement.
Refers to a fierce, raptor-like bird.
Common biblical term for land animals, often wild ones.

verses.text: 許多牧人毀壞了我的葡萄園，踐踏了我的田地；他們使我美好的田地變為荒涼的曠野。

words.note: A frequent term in biblical contexts, referring to those who tend sheep.
A common motif in the Bible, often symbolizing Israel or God's people.
A significant setting in biblical narratives, representing trials or isolation.

verses.text: 他們使地荒涼，在我面前一片荒涼悲哀；全地荒涼，卻無人關心。」

words.note: Often used in biblical prophetic contexts.

words.definition: a stretch of, a scene of

words.note: Often used in biblical prophetic contexts.
Often used in biblical prophetic contexts.

verses.text: 在曠野一切光禿的高岡上，行毀滅的已經來到了；因為耶和華的刀從地這邊直到地那邊，要吞滅一切；人人都沒有平安。

words.note: Common term in biblical narratives.
Descriptive term for terrain in biblical contexts.
Frequently used for divine judgment.
Transliteration of YHWH, the personal name of God.
Used metaphorically for destruction.
Reduplication emphasizes 'each and every person'.
Significant concept in biblical theology.

verses.text: 他們種的是小麥，收的卻是荊棘；雖然筋疲力竭，卻一無所獲。因耶和華的烈怒，他們必為自己的（「自己的」原文作「你們的」）出產羞愧（本句或譯：「你們必為你們的農穫羞愧」）。

words.note: Common imagery in the Bible for curse or difficulty.
An idiom meaning 'muscles tired, strength exhausted'.
An idiom meaning 'not gain anything'.
Transliteration of YHWH, the personal name of God.
Often refers to divine wrath in the Bible.

verses.text: 警告惡鄰耶和華這樣說：「至於所有邪惡的鄰國，他們侵犯我賜給我子民以色列的產業；看哪！我要把他們從本地拔出來，也要把猶大家從他們中間拔出來。

words.note: Specifically refers to hostile nations/peoples.
Transliteration of YHWH, the personal name of God.
Often refers to divine giving or grace.
Commonly refers to God's chosen people.
Name of a person, nation, and land in the Bible.
Often refers to land or spiritual inheritance from God.
An exclamation drawing attention to what follows.
Refers to the tribe or kingdom of Judah.

verses.text: 但我把他們拔出來以後，我必再憐憫他們，把他們領回來，各自歸回自己的產業，自己的故鄉。

words.note: A key concept of God's character in the Bible.
Often refers to land or spiritual inheritance from God.

verses.text: 如果那些鄰近的國家真的學習我子民的道路，指著我的名起誓，說：『我指著永活的耶和華起誓！』正如他們從前教導我的子民指著巴力起誓一樣，他們就必在我的子民中間被建立起來。

words.note: Refers to a ruler's or God's people.
Often used to describe God.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
A Canaanite deity worshipped by various ancient Semitic peoples.
Indicates consequence or immediacy.
Expresses strong affirmation or necessity.
Indicates that the subject undergoes the action.
Indicates upward movement or beginning of action.

verses.text: 他們如果有不聽從的，我就把那國拔出來，把她拔除消滅。」這是耶和華的宣告。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from a verb or adjective.
Indicates consequence or immediacy.
Introduces the object of a verb, placing it before the verb.
Indicates movement outwards or emergence.
Refers to the nation (國) as a feminine entity.
